Package main.java.it.polimi.ingsw.Model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
main.java.it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Board
public class Board extends Object
class Board represent the board where the tile are positioned

    • Board

      public Board()

    • Board

      public Board(int numOfPlayers) throws InvalidParameterException
      Constructor of the class, it builds the board setting the available spot based on the number of players
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - number of players playing the game
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException

    • Board

      public Board(TilePlacingSpot[][] grid)
      Creates a board object given a TilePlacingSpot[][] - it does not check for the validity of the grid

    • Board

      public Board(Board b)
      Creates a copy of the passed board

  • Method Details

    • drawTiles

      public List<Tile> drawTiles(int x, int y, int amount, Board.Direction direction) throws InvalidMoveException, InvalidParameterException
      This method is used to draw tiles from the board
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the starting position on the board [0 ... 8]
      y - y coordinate of the starting position on the board [0 ... 8]
      amount - number of tiles to be drawn
      direction - the direction in which to move to draw the tiles
      Returns:
      a list containing the tiles drawn
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException - if the selected tiles cannot be drawn according to the game rules
      InvalidParameterException - if the coordinate are wrong

    • coordinateOutOfBounds

      private boolean coordinateOutOfBounds(int x, int y)
      This private methods checks if the coordinates are valid or out of the bounds of the matrix
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are out of bound, false if they are valid

    • isThisPositionEmpty

      public boolean isThisPositionEmpty(int x, int y)
      This method check if a position is empty or alredy occupied by a Tile
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if there is not a Tile in the position described by the parameters, false otherwise

    • isThisTileDrawable

      private boolean isThisTileDrawable(int x, int y)
      It checks if the Tile can be drawn from the board
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordiante
      Returns:
      true if There is at least an empty position in the adiacent cells, false otherwise

    • setAlwaysUnavailableSpot

      private void setAlwaysUnavailableSpot()
      This method sets to false the flag on the PlacingSpot that are not available in any game mode

    • setUnavailableSpotForTwoPlayersBoard

      private void setUnavailableSpotForTwoPlayersBoard()
      This method sets to false the flag on the PlacingSpot that are not available in a 2 players game

    • setUnavailableSpotForThreePlayerBoard

      private void setUnavailableSpotForThreePlayerBoard()
      This method sets to false the flag on the PlacingSpot that are not available in a 3 players game

    • refill

      public void refill()
      This method clean the board of the remaining tiles, puts them back in the bag and then proceed to refill every available position with new tiles drawn from the bag

    • isRefillneeded

      private boolean isRefillneeded()
      This method checks if all the Tiles present on the board are isolated prompting the need of a refill of the board
      Returns:
      a boolean value, true if all the Tiles on the board are isolated and false if there is at list one that is not isolated

    • printGridMap

      public void printGridMap()
      this method is used to print on terminal the state of the board

    • setTile

      public void setTile(int x, int y)
      this method position a tile in a specific spot (used only for testing)
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate
      y - coordinate

      public TilePlacingSpot[][] getBoardForDisplay()
      This method returns a copy of the board to display

    • getTilesForView

      public List<Tile> getTilesForView(int x, int y, int amount, Board.Direction direction) throws InvalidMoveException
      Returns:
      the selected tiles without drawing them
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException
